## GETTING STARTED

Loading tidyverse into R environment by using the code chunk below.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse)
```
:::



## Importing data

Code chunk below uses read_csv() of readr to import the Exam_data dataset into R environment.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```
:::



## Compare R Graphics with ggplot

::: {.panel-tabset}
### R Graphics


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(exam_data$MATHS)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### ggplot2


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=10, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="black", 
                 fill="grey") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


:::
